intro: Cyphostemma setosum, commonly known as the spiny cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a waxy texture. Cyphostemma setosum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
